intro: Bupleurum breviinvolucratum, commonly known as the short-involucrate bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky slopes. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided leaflets, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps.
